method.name: StatGeneralMO

reference.ref: A. Martínez, C. Rodríguez and R. Gutiérrez, Inferencia Estadística, un enfoque clásico, Ed. Piramide.
J.P. Royston, Algorithm AS 181, Applied Statistics 31(2):176-180, 1982

generalDescription.type: Statistical method for comparing regression models performance.
generalDescription.objective: Statistical comparing of the performance of a regression model method. Statistical tests, like Wilcoxon signed ranks or Mann-Whitney u, are executed for comparing methods purposes.
generalDescription.howWork:
StatGeneralMO is a method for comparing the performance of regression modelling algorithms using statistics techniques. It can be used in k-folds and 5x2 cross validation training experiments.
StatGeneralMO is associated to the training and testing results of all of the models in an experiment that are to be compared. Once those models has been trained and tested, the StatGeneralMO takes place.
The process calculates the mean square error for each of the partitions results. The statistical sample includes all of those error measures for each method to be compared.
With the Royston implementation of the W test it is contrasted if error distributions are normal for the samples to be compare. If the distributions are normal, then if the samples are of equal variance the t test is executed. If distributions are normal but they have different variances then the tvar test. Finally, if the samples are not normal, then the Wilcoxon test is executed.
The statistical test are executed in order to find evidence to assert that the error distribution of the different regression methods are different or not. If they are different, then it can be stated which one is of better performance.

method.example:
Problem type: Regression Methods to compare: ModelLinearLMS vs ModelFuzzyWangMendel Dataset: MachineCPU Type of partitions: k-fold, k=10
After the execution of RunKeel.jar we can see into the ./results/StatGeneralMO/TSTModelLinearLMSvsModelFuzzyWangMendel/ folder the classification results for the tested regression method:
Results: Detected 2 methods Folds=10 10 Results: Test-Dataset ModelLinearLMS ModelFuzzyWangMendel Fold=0 318,0000 325,5508 142,1333 12,0000 36,8573 6,0000 23,0000 15,9661 6,0097 24,0000 5,0609 6,4635 ... ... 24,0000 -8,5479 6,0232 136,0000 205,1678 133,0407 Sample #0 = 6269.121643564491 2147.230910972645 1995.3648161815602 8429.333677837989 3752.9449714139996 1265.7506453865049 1378.2416180169002 68590.16398661592 3047.5560397716117 6650.378912568549 Expected error: ModelLinearLMS ModelFuzzyWangMendel 5283,9435 14962,4010 Median of errors: ModelLinearLMS ModelFuzzyWangMendel 3768,6589 EXAMPLE 2
Problem type: Regression Methods to compare: ModelLinearLMS vs ModelFuzzyWangMendel Dataset: machineCPU Type of partitions: 5x2cv
After the execution of RunKeel.jar we can see into the ./results/StatGeneralMO/TSTModelLinearLMSvsModelFuzzyWangMendel/ folder the classification results for the tested regression method:
